alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 9:02PM PST until December 27 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 7 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT..Heavy snow expected, with winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches at higher elevations and within the warning area, with locally higher amounts of up to 2 feet possible along higher ridges. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches in the Advisory area. * WHERE...In California, Modoc County, and in Oregon, Klamath Basin, Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Lake County. The Warning area includes Lakeview, Valley Falls, Davis Creek, Chiloquin, and Chemult. The Advisory area includes Klamath Falls, Bly, Alturas, Paisley, Silver Lake, Fort Rock, and Adel. Significant impacts are expected for all area roads and highways. * WHEN...The Winter Storm Warning is in effect from 10 AM Sunday to 7 AM PST Monday. The Winter Weather Advisory is in effect until 7 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel and the morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
